body:
By the way, although I like this change, and it will likely be pretty nice for a lot of reasons, I don't expect it will impact CI times very much. Installing NPM dependencies is a minority of the time we spend, and a lot of Yarn's super powers come from really good caching which we don't get in CI. I expect we will get a small speedup for NPM  installs, and that the change to the overall CI time will be lost in the noise.

This is still something I'm glad to do. As I've worked more with NPM 5's package locking solution, the less impressed I've become. It will help local development, and I think it is overall a better tool for the job.

body_html:
By the way, although I like this change, and it will likely be pretty nice for a lot of reasons, I don't expect it will impact CI times very much. Installing NPM dependencies is a minority of the time we spend, and a lot of Yarn's super powers come from really good caching which we don't get in CI. I expect we will get a small speedup for NPM installs, and that the change to the overall CI time will be lost in the noise.

This is still something I'm glad to do. As I've worked more with NPM 5's package locking solution, the less impressed I've become. It will help local development, and I think it is overall a better tool for the job.
